solution_line_template: Eating three times a day, a dog eats {dog_meals_per_day}*{dog_food_per_meal}=<<{dog_meals_per_day}*{dog_food_per_meal}={dog_daily_food}>>{dog_daily_food} pounds of food.

Since there are {num_dogs} dogs at the camp, the total amount of food they eat is {num_dogs}*{dog_daily_food}=<<{num_dogs}*{dog_daily_food}={total_dog_food_daily}>>{total_dog_food_daily} pounds of food in a day.

If each dog eats twice as much food as a puppy, a puppy will eat {dog_food_per_meal}/{dog_puppy_food_ratio}=<<{dog_food_per_meal}/{dog_puppy_food_ratio}={puppy_food_per_meal}>>{puppy_food_per_meal} pounds of food in one meal.

Each puppy eats three times as often as a dog, and if a dog eats three times in a day, a puppy will eat {dog_meals_per_day}*{puppy_dog_meal_frequency_ratio}= <<{dog_meals_per_day}*{puppy_dog_meal_frequency_ratio}={puppy_meals_per_day}>>{puppy_meals_per_day} times in a day.

Since a puppy eats {puppy_food_per_meal} pounds of food a day, the total amount of food a puppy will eat in a day is {puppy_meals_per_day}*{puppy_food_per_meal}=<<{puppy_meals_per_day}*{puppy_food_per_meal}={puppy_daily_food}>>{puppy_daily_food} pounds of food.
Four puppies in the camp eat {puppy_daily_food}*{num_puppies}=<<{puppy_daily_food}*{num_puppies}={total_puppy_food_daily}>>{total_puppy_food_daily} pounds of food every day.

Together, the dogs and the puppies eat {total_puppy_food_daily}+{total_dog_food_daily}=<<{total_puppy_food_daily}+{total_dog_food_daily}={total_food_daily}>>{total_food_daily} pounds of food in a day.
